column4: Good afternoon. My name is Roberto, and I think my Ethernet card is running like two or three times slower than it should. I am running Ubuntu 6, and the card is D-Link DFE-520TX. It should download at 120kbps, but it is only performing at 40kbps. I think it might be because the speed_duplex is not set to 2. Any help?
use mii-tool to see what its conencted as.
means its not connected at 100Base-T not 10Base-T, which would explain the slowness.
whoops, got those two reversed, but you know what I mean. Its connected at 10Base-T not 100Base-T, which is why its slow.
